page.title: 15FROZEN FISH DEPOT, LONG ROCK
page.content: Much of the fish caught locally and brought ashore at Newlyn goes to Shippams Cannery. It is gutted and cut to size, then brought by lorry to the large store at Long Rock where only two staff are needed. Here it is frozen into slabs at a temperature of _30 C. The process takes 1 hour and 55 minutes. Then the frozen slabs of fish are boxed, labelled and stored in a huge freezer room. They may remain here for up to a year. When needed the frozen crabmeat, mackerel and pilchards are defrosted and taken back to the cannery at Newlyn. They are thawed and put into tins ready for sale. Off-cuts of fish, and white fish are sent to Shippams factory in Chichester to be made into fish paste.
